Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Veritable \Ver"i*ta*ble\, a. [F. v['e]ritable. See {Verity}.] Agreeable to truth or to fact; actual; real; true; genuine. ``The veritable Deity.'' --Sir W. Hamilton. -- {Ver"i*ta*bly}, adv. [1913 Webster]

veritable adj 1: often used as intensifiers; "a regular morass of details"; "a regular nincompoop"; "he's a veritable swine" [syn: {regular(a)}, {veritable(a)}] 2: not counterfeit or copied; "an authentic signature"; "a bona fide manuscript"; "an unquestionable antique"; "photographs taken in a veritable bull ring" [syn: {authentic}, {bona fide}, {unquestionable}]
